journal-title-group.journal-title: Computational and Mathematical Methods in Medicine

title-group.article-title: RETRACTION: The Roles of KIFC1 in the Development of Osteosarcoma: Characterization of Potential Therapeutic Targets

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright © 2025 Computational and Mathematical Methods in Medicine published by John Wiley & Sons Ltd.

license.license-p: This is an open access article under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution License, which permits use, distribution and reproduction in any medium, provided the original work is properly cited.

body.p: RETRACTION: L.-Y. Liang and G.-S. Li. “The Roles of KIFC1 in the Development of Osteosarcoma: Characterization of Potential Therapeutic Targets,” Computational and Mathematical Methods in Medicine, no. 2022 (2022): 1–10. https://doi.org/10.1155/2022/5039134.
The above article [1], published online on 18 April 2022 in Wiley Online Library (http://wileyonlinelibrary.com), has been retracted by John Wiley & Sons Ltd.
The retraction has been agreed following an investigation of the concerns raised by Hoya camphorifolia on PubPeer [1], which identified an instance of figure duplication.

-Figure 4b: The Western Blot bands corresponding to KIFC1 and β-actin expression in the U-2 OS cells have been duplicated in Figure 5b of [2], where they are labelled as Ki-67 and β-actin expression in KIF15-knockout tumors.
As a result of the investigation, the data and conclusions of this article are considered unreliable.
The authors were informed of the decision to retract the article but did not provide a response.

element-citation.article-title: The Roles of KIFC1 in the Development of Osteosarcoma: Characterization of Potential Therapeutic Targets
RETRACTED ARTICLE: Kinesin Family Member 15 Can Promote the Proliferation of Glioblastoma
